name: Smith Machine Slight Incline Press
how_to_perform:
1. Set an adjustable bench to a slight incline, approximately 15 to 30 degrees and position it inside the Smith machine.
2. Sit on the bench, ensuring your back is supported against the incline and your feet are firmly planted on the ground for stability.
3. Position yourself under the bar so that it lines up with your upper chest.
4. With a shoulder-width grip, grasp the bar with your palms facing forward.
5. Unrack the bar by rotating it forward or pressing the release lever if the Smith machine has one.
6. Lower the bar slowly and under control to chest level, stopping just before it touches your chest.
7. Press the bar back up to the starting position by extending your elbows, ensuring to exhale during this pushing phase.
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
9. After completing your set, re-rack the bar by rotating it back to its starting position or using the lock mechanism.
short_summary: The Smith Machine Slight Incline Press is a chest exercise performed on a bench set to a slight incline within a Smith machine, targeting the upper chest and shoulder muscles.
alternative_names: Incline Chest Press on Smith Machine
